headline: Nike (NKE) Stock Is Up, What You Need To Know
summary: Shares of athletic apparel brand Nike (NYSE:NKE) jumped 4.9% in the afternoon session after the company posted third-quarter results that surpassed Wall Street's expectations for both revenue and profit. The athletic apparel giant reported revenue of $11.72 billion, a modest 1.1% increase year-on-year, but this was enough to comfortably beat analyst estimates of $11 billion. headline: Peloton stock falls on product revamp, Nike's turnaround traction
summary: Yahoo Finance's John Hyland tracks Wednesday's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute. The government shutdown will delay Friday's September job report. Meanwhile, ADP jobs data showed a loss of 32,000 private jobs in September. Nike (NKE) stock is gaining on the company's first quarter earnings beat, showing traction in its turnaround plan. Peloton (PTON) stock is falling after the company revealed its revamped products and price hikes. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

content.title: Peloton stock falls on product revamp, Nike's turnaround traction
content.description:
Yahoo Finance's John Hyland tracks Wednesday's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute.

The government shutdown will delay Friday's September job report. Meanwhile, ADP jobs data showed a loss of 32,000 private jobs in September.

Nike (NKE) stock is gaining on the company's first quarter earnings beat, showing traction in its turnaround plan.

Peloton (PTON) stock is falling after the company revealed its revamped products and price hikes.

Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Nike working through tariff headwinds in its turnaround plan
summary: Shares of footwear and athletic apparel juggernaut Nike (NKE) continue to rise Wednesday morning after outpacing fiscal first quarter revenue and earnings estimates, reported yesterday. Nike saw revenues rise year-over-year amid CEO Elliott Hill's turnaround plan, while the company raised its tariff impacts to $1.5 billion Yahoo Finance senior reporter Brooke DiPalma and Ritholtz Wealth Management chief market strategist Callie Cox weigh in on the brand's sales forecasts, tariff headwinds, and greater consumer trends in the US and China. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: Nike Warns ‘Progress Won’t Be Linear’ After Earnings Beat. The Stock Rises Anyway.
summary: Nike’s turnaround plan helped the company sprint ahead of fiscal first-quarter earnings expectations, sending the stock higher in premarket trading Tuesday.  Shares of Nike have shed roughly 30% over the past three years, trading at similar levels as in mid-2018 and erasing most of the gains made during the pandemic-era boom in activewear.  The company’s new management team, led by CEO Elliott Hill, has been working to rectify the business by cleaning out inventories to stock up on new styles and fixing relationships with wholesale partners.

content.title: Nike Warns ‘Progress Won’t Be Linear’ After Earnings Beat. The Stock Rises Anyway.
content.summary: Nike’s turnaround plan helped the company sprint ahead of fiscal first-quarter earnings expectations, sending the stock higher in premarket trading Tuesday.  Shares of Nike have shed roughly 30% over the past three years, trading at similar levels as in mid-2018 and erasing most of the gains made during the pandemic-era boom in activewear.  The company’s new management team, led by CEO Elliott Hill, has been working to rectify the business by cleaning out inventories to stock up on new styles and fixing relationships with wholesale partners.

headline: Nike sees surprise rise in Q1 revenue as turnaround takes root
summary: STORY: Nike on Tuesday reported a surprise rise in Q1 revenue and beat profit forecasts. The sportswear brand’s turnaround effort has gained traction…Despite weakness in China and U.S. tariff pressures. Also, the company’s wholesale revenues returned to growth and it managed to clear some of its bloated inventory. Signs of progress for CEO Elliott Hill’s plan to reinvigorate Nike. He’s vowed to refocus the brand around core sports like running, following a string of weak quartersHowever, executives warned the recovery was still a way off.Nike expects tariffs to cost about $1.5 billion this year - compared with the previously expected $1 billion. The sportswear brand makes nearly all its shoes in countries such as Vietnam that have been hit with steep duties under U.S. President Donald Trump.And China, Nike's third-largest market, has been a particular problem. Sales there fell for the fifth straight quarter for the three months ending August 31, as it faces strong competition from domestic brands.  Hill admitted Nike still had "work ahead to get all sports, geographies, and channels on a similar path."

content.title: Nike sees surprise rise in Q1 revenue as turnaround takes root
content.description:
STORY: Nike on Tuesday reported a surprise rise in Q1 revenue and beat profit forecasts. 

The sportswear brand’s turnaround effort has gained traction…

Despite weakness in China and U.S. tariff pressures. 

Also, the company’s wholesale revenues returned to growth and it managed to clear some of its bloated inventory. 

Signs of progress for CEO Elliott Hill’s plan to reinvigorate Nike. 

He’s vowed to refocus the brand around core sports like running, following a string of weak quarters

However, executives warned the recovery was still a way off.

Nike expects tariffs to cost about $1.5 billion this year - compared with the previously expected $1 billion. 

The sportswear brand makes nearly all its shoes in countries such as Vietnam that have been hit with steep duties under U.S. President Donald Trump.

And China, Nike's third-largest market, has been a particular problem. 

Sales there fell for the fifth straight quarter for the three months ending August 31, as it faces strong competition from domestic brands.  

Hill admitted Nike still had "work ahead to get all sports, geographies, and channels on a similar path."
content.summary: STORY: Nike on Tuesday reported a surprise rise in Q1 revenue and beat profit forecasts. The sportswear brand’s turnaround effort has gained traction…Despite weakness in China and U.S. tariff pressures. Also, the company’s wholesale revenues returned to growth and it managed to clear some of its bloated inventory. Signs of progress for CEO Elliott Hill’s plan to reinvigorate Nike. He’s vowed to refocus the brand around core sports like running, following a string of weak quartersHowever, executives warned the recovery was still a way off.Nike expects tariffs to cost about $1.5 billion this year - compared with the previously expected $1 billion. The sportswear brand makes nearly all its shoes in countries such as Vietnam that have been hit with steep duties under U.S. President Donald Trump.And China, Nike's third-largest market, has been a particular problem. Sales there fell for the fifth straight quarter for the three months ending August 31, as it faces strong competition from domestic brands.  Hill admitted Nike still had "work ahead to get all sports, geographies, and channels on a similar path."
